intro: Sphaereupatorium scandens, commonly known as the climbing sphaereupatorium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems that twine around support structures as it climbs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sphaereupatorium scandens is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas.
